docs.lead_paragraph: The Markets of a City lie pretty well back among the first causes. Those who are not in the habit of living exclusively on vitiated air and dust must regard the market as quite prominent among the essentials of life. Dr. FRANKLIN'S dinner of sawdust might be obtained at the wood-sawyer's; but your smoking sirloin and your tender steak, your chickens...

docs.lead_paragraph: So much has been said about the hard treatment of emigrants by "runners," "agents," , that we doubt not there prevails very extensively an impression that the protection we afford to the sick and destitute who come to us from abroad is very much like the protection that wolves give to lambs.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: LETTERS FROM UNDER A LAMP.; NUMBER NINE. Original Commentator. A Difference. A First-Rate Story for Lawyers. Biography of Randolph

docs.lead_paragraph: MY DEAR SIR: All the starch is out of me to-night. I cannot write you a literary letter, but I can extemporize a few incidents, that you may find sufficient for a column of the TIMES.
docs.snippet: MY DEAR SIR: All the starch is out of me to-night. I cannot write you a literary letter, but I can extemporize a few incidents, that you may find sufficient for a column of the TIMES.

headline.main: ADDITIONAL CITY NEWS.; For the other City News of this morning, ses Sixth Page. Amusements this Evening. Full Particulars may be found in our Advertising Columns.

docs.lead_paragraph: BROADWAY THEATRE.--Macbeth--Little Toddlekins. WALLACK'S THEATRE.--Don Caesar de Bazan--Review. BURTON'S THEATRE.--Town and County--Love, Law, Physic. ST. CHARLES THEATRE.--Ladies Rights in 1953--Irish Jonah--Military Executions.
docs.abstract: His Yacht North Star on the Rocks
docs.snippet: BROADWAY THEATRE.--Macbeth--Little Toddlekins. WALLACK'S THEATRE.--Don Caesar de Bazan--Review. BURTON'S THEATRE.--Town and County--Love, Law, Physic. ST. CHARLES THEATRE.--Ladies Rights in 1953--Irish Jonah--Military Executions.

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE AFRICA. DEBATES ON THE KOSSUTH AFFAIR. A SPECK OF WAR IN PERSIA. Cotton Steady---Breadstuffs Dull. ENGLAND. Lively Discussion in Parliament on the Kossuth Affair. A Scene in the House of Commons--Board of Trade--Peace Movements--Rothschild's Seat in Parliement. Miscellaneous. FRANCE. Health of the Empress--The Legacies of the first Napoleon--A new Police--Mass for Napoleon le Grand--His Tomb. GERMANY. Troubles in Hesse Cassel. SPAIN. Relations of France and Spain--No Crisis at present. PORTUGAL. ITALY. Riot in the Tryol--A Roman Financial Scheme--Austrian Movements. SWITZERLAND. Election Fight. HOLLAND. Religions Movements.--Marriage of Prince Henry. DENMARK. The Opposition in a Minority. RUSSIA. Confiscation of the Property of Exiles, &c.: TURKEY. All Going Smoothly. GREECE. Complicated Relations with Turkey. PERSIA. A Speck of War in the East.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Africa, Captain HARRISON, arrived at this port at noon yesterday, bringing dates from Liverpool to the 7th inst. The Africa brings 76 passengers, whose names will be found under the appropriate heading. The steamship Washington had not been telegraphed from Southampton when tile Africa left Liverpool.

docs.lead_paragraph: CONSTITUTIONAL TALENT.--There is nothing that floats a man sooner into tile tide of reputation, or often passes current for genius, than what might be called "constitutional talent." A man without this, whatever may be his worth or real powers, will no more get on in the world than a leaden Mercury will fly in the air; as any pretender with it,

docs.lead_paragraph: DAVID BROMBUSH was born in 1762, at Bergen, N. J., and at 18 years of age was employed by Gen. WASHINGTON to cart specie to pay off the troops and perform other duties as required. He was an industrious farmer and mechanic, and raised with his own hands in 1801 the old building which stood on the corner of Cedar-street and Broadway.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Seventh Anniversary of the "Society for Relief of Destitute Children of Seamen," was celebrated yesterday at the Home-a handsome brick building erected on an eminence near the Sailors' Snug Harber, Staten Island. A large company of the friends to the Institution with their families, assembled on board the steamboat Staten Islander, at 12 o'clock.

docs.lead_paragraph: The leafy month of June will bring us to those Summer heats, that relax our muscles and wilt our strength; and an earnest question will demand reply from many of our citizens, Where shall we go Shall we seek the shade of inland oaks, or bend our steps to the roar of the surf, and catch the ocean's healthful breath?
